text:
East Tremont Ave., east side, between Puritan and Mayflower Aves., showing (successively) the Cardo Bros., G. Palumbo, and F. Colino marble yards. The view is in a southerly direction from Whittemore Ave.

July 9, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

St. Raymonds Cemetery(Bronx): The entrance to the cemetry on the west side of E. Tremont Avenue, between Whittemore and Baisley Avenues.

July 9, 1928

P.L. Sperr
title: Cemeteries - St. Raymonds Cemetery - Bronx.
